loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros lives in Kulen district of Preah Vihea province. She is now 41 years old, married and has 4 children. Two of her children are in school. In order to support the family, Ros and her husband depend on the paddy rice farm as their main income. This business helps them earn 17500 KHR on average per day. 

She is now requesting her new loan with VisionFund to pay for labor fees. She expects that the income will help her in expanding her current business as well as improving her family's living. The income will be used to cover her family's food, health care and the children's education.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Vin lives in Kulen district of Preah Vihea province. She is now 35 years old and single. She depends mainly on her paddy rice farm to make a living. She earns 13,000 KHR on average per day.

She has completed 4 loans with VisionFund already. She saw a very good impact on her living with the previous loans and now is requesting for the fifth one to pay for labor fees. She expects that the income will help her in expanding her current business and covering her living expenses such as food and health care.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin lives in the Kulen District in Preah Vihea Province. She is 29 years old, married, and has 4 children, two of whom are attending school. In order to support the family, Phin and her husband operate a paddy rice farm. It helps them earn 27,000 KHR on average per day.

Phin is now requesting her first loan with VisionFund to pay for labor fees. She expects that the income will help her expand the business and cover her family's living expenses, such as food, health care, and the children's education.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Zikira

texts.en: Zikira is a 49-year-old married woman. Two years ago, she started a small general store in her community with her son. Since then, she has attained a good number of customers. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. Zikira wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Okilhuja

texts.ru:
Окилхуджа с детства любил мастеров по изготовления древесинных окон и дверей  мечтал стать мастером. После окончания средний школы он начал пойти к мастеру чтобы научиться изготавливать окон и дверей. Благодаря, его развитому уму и интеллекту, его карьера развивается быстро. Он в данный момент сам работает мастером и любит свою профессию. Окилхуджа является хорошим семьянином тоже. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенок.
 Место деятельности Окилхучи находится в очень   плохом состоянии, и он должен срочно отремонтировать свое место деятельности. Заработной платы  не хватает для проведения ремонта. Окилхуча обратился в Арванд за кредитом. ОН запрашивает займ  для покупки краски, цемент  другие строительные материалы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Okilhuja has loved manufacturing of wooden windows and doors since his childhood, and dreamed of becoming a master carpenter. After finishing secondary school, he started going to a master carpenter to learn how to make doors and windows. Thanks to his well-developed mind and intellect, his career developed rapidly. Currently he works as a master carpenter himself, and he loves his profession. Okilhuja is a good family man too. He is married and raising one child. 

Okilhuja's work place is in very bad condition, and he urgently needs to repair it. His salary is not enough to carry out the repairs. Okilhuja turned to Arvand for a loan. He requests a loan in order to purchase paint, cement and other building materials. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair his workshop

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has nine years of experience in this field.  She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 49-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for the past 16 years. With five cows, she sells milk and butter to many of her neighbors; business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life.  

Bushra works hard to steadily improve her enterprise to better meet the daily expenses of life. She has requested her eighth loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase an additional cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

Bushra is very motivated to provide her family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business manufacturing footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone.  

For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, spools of threads and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, spools of threads and leather covers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is 49-year-old, vigorous lady. For many years, she has been stitching clothes for the people of her community, and she uses her income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. Shahida intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to allow her to increase her revenues so she can generate a healthier income. This will be her fifth loan, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two hard-working members. The leader is Stella, age 54. She is single with one child and she sells clothes at the market. With this loan Stella plans to continue investing in additional merchandise. She will buy clothes for resale to her customers. 

There is one other member in the group: Ernest, age 33, who sells provisions.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Shahjahan

texts.en: Shahjahan is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Shahjahan is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings from her increased sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments, maize and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, juice, posho, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 24 décembre 2010 à l'inauguration du bv qui l'abrite. Il est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et exerçant toutes l'élevage et le petit commerce comme activité. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la représentante Amy est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 filles dont les 03 sont mariées. 

La dame en médaillon était absente lors de la prise de photo du groupe.

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète un mouton à 30 000frs, engraisse avec de l'aliment de bétail et vaccine pour 15 000frs et le reste de l'argent, elle exerce une activité de vente de poudre d'arachide 

Après 06 mois elle revend le mouton à 70 000frs et la poudre d'arachide quant à elle à 700 frs le kg et cette activité se fait mensuellement.  

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en renforçant la qualité de la nourriture avec une partie et avec l'autre elle augmente ses épargnes et paie ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 24, 2010, at the launch of the Banc Villageois to which it belongs. The group members share a good social bond, and their activities consist of animal farming and small trade. 

The group’s representative is Amy, seen in the photo standing at the far right and raising her hand. Amy, age 60, is the married mother of four daughters, three of them also married. 

With this loan, Amy will buy one sheep for 30,000 frs that she will fatten with cattle feed, and she will spend 15,000 frs on vaccination. Any remainder will be invested in her other activity, namely the sale of groundnut powder. 

She will sell the sheep after 6 months for 70,000 frs. She sells her groundnut powder for 700 frs per kg on a monthly basis. 

Part of the profits earned through these activities help her to improve her family’s living conditions with better food quality, while the remainder is used to bolster her savings and pay her interests. 

The lady seen inset was not available when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and some rakal to feed it, and to pay for its vaccination; any remainder will be used to buy groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and ginger to expand her business.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf is a 22-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shamem

texts.en: Shamem is a 43-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items, vegetables and daily use products at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shamem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Riaz is a vigorous 32-year-old lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosmery tiene 25 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,gaseosas,golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche y arroz para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de regalos, ferretería, venta de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes y artesanía. 
En la foto salen tres niños hijos de los socios.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the Province and Department of the same name.

Rosmery is 25 years old, in a common-law relationship and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with her business which is a grocery store. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, sweets amongst others. She has been running this business for quite a while and things are going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work each day. She is a diligent and responsible person and she gets her family ahead in this way. Rosmery is requesting a loan to buy rice and milk for her business.

The other members have businesses like the sale of gifts, a hardware store, selling clothes, selling food. a grocery store and handicrafts. Three of the members' children appear in the photo. Rosmery is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk and rice for her business.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
The borrower has been involved in agriculture for six years and grows mainly crops and vegetables. She sells crops and vegetables in a local market. With the profits she earns from sales she helps cover family expenses. She is married and has five children. 

Salomat lives with her family in her own home. She is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help with her cultivating activity, such as fertilizers and seeds, and to pay hired workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and to pay hired workers

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of five children.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 55 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with three children. She has been running her general store for eight years now. 

She makes an estimated monthly income of 28,000 KES. She would like a loan of 30,000 KES through which she will be able to pay for her children's school fees. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans.

The profits that she makes will be used to repay the current loan. In future, she hopes that she will be able to educate her children to higher levels and own a residential home and rental houses to make extra income.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 46, is running a food stall in her street with the support of her husband. She makes delicious ‘Dahi Bhallay’, which is a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. She has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town.

In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas mas  entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Santusa sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other things. She has a small grocery store in her home. She is a responsible person which is why she was invited to participate in the community bank "Camino al Progreso." This time, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products. She is grateful for and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products

loans.name: Adalid Alberto

texts.es: Adalid de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 9 años, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, adalid está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adalid is 49 years old. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their two children. He has earned his living growing corn for nine years. He sells in the areas surrounding the place where he lives. With the profits that he earns, he is able to cover some of the expenses that come up in his household. 

In order to continue with his crops and to give his family a better quality of life, Adalid is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Yesenia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en la vivienda y así evitar que el agua se filtre cuando llueve. Con el monto solicitado comprará 5 docenas de lámina, polines y pines. Espera poder contar con esta financiamiento y poder dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible. Ella ya ha tenido crédito con la institución y demostró responsabilidad en el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en: Yesenia is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She makes a living as a domestic servant in order to help support her household. Yesenia is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of a corridor in her home so that water is diverted from the house when it rains. With the sum of this loan, she will buy five dozen sheets of metal, wood, and screws to build a corridor. Yesenia hopes, with this loan, to be able to start building as soon as possible. She has already borrowed from this institution previously and demonstrated responsibility with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy five dozen sheets of metal, wood, and screws to build a corridor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de  22 años de edad se dedica desde hace 2 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal y ayudante de albañilería, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, el cliente está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de los insumos necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, y asi tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This 22-year-old client has earned his living for two years in agriculture. He grows corn and beans; in addition to that, he also works as a day laborer and construction assistant. With what he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. He lives with his wife and their son in a house that he owns. 

The client is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL for the purchase of necessary supplies like seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph. That way, he will have better income and be able to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 52 years old, married, and has two children. The eldest of them is 24 years old and she is married, but the little child is 21 years old and not married. Ali is living with his family in Baku region, but the family members are IDPs - Internally Displaced Persons -  from their hometown, Khojaly city. 

Ali has been in the poultry business for seven years. He earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customers. Today, he wants to increase his business, and for this reason, he applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

With this loan, he wants to buy more chickens, grow them, and resell for gain. Also, Ali wants to build a little hen-coop. He says great thanks to Kiva organization and all lenders for the aid. 

In the future, Ali wants to have a poultry enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and build a little hen-coop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 40-year-old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells soft drinks and food in her restaurant in a bus Trading Center. The general public are her major clients. She wants a loan to buy more soft drinks, such as splash and sodas to resell. She has a dream of building a good residential house for her family, despite the challenge of lack of electricity.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, such as splash and sodas to resell.

loans.name: Pervin

texts.en:
Pervin is 43 years old and doing a business of scrap for many years, with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). 

She buys pet bottles, such as Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) or other similar bottles in scrap. After properly crushing and recycling these bottles, she sells them to the people of her community. Through her business, she makes an enough amount of income to contribute to the family income.

She has four children; she hardly manages to satisfy their needs. She is liable to provide them with good food, health, and clothing, so she requires earning more income to support her family well.

She is in her eighth loan cycle with Kashf foundation, as she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy more bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earning, and wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles in different sizes.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 47-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.  She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 47-year-old married woman. She started her business of decoration sales with the support her husband some years ago. She offers a variety of wall hangings, vases, artificial flowers, etc. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. It will help her purchase more items of decorations, such as wall hangings, vases, candles and wall mirrors. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to increase her sales by offering a bigger collection to her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more items for decorations, such as wall hangings, vases, candles, and wall mirrors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of flip-flops, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 24 years old and living at home with his family. He works in agriculture, cultivating corn to sell to help his family with household expenses. The client is applying for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land which is seen in the photograph. His continued work will generate a good income and give have him and his family a better quality-of-life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair products and cosmetics to expand her business.

loans.name: Zaib  Unnisa

texts.en:
Zaib Unnisa is a married woman. She is successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet their household expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more green vegetable to expand her business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She, with her husband, is doing work of agriculture for many years. She crops different vegetables and sells them at the local market. 
Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Safia applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Nyamira area of South Nyanza with her husband and two children, all of whom are of school-going age. She is a very hardworking and dedicated farmer who deals in milk, eggs, bananas, and tomatoes as her main sources of income. 

She also has a small retail business, which is an extra source of income. She states that in farming, her biggest challenges are diseases affecting crops and livestock, and the lack of storage facilities for water.

Susan wanted a water tank for storage of water, mainly for her farming activities. So she took a Kiva loan that will help her purchase a water tank. This will ensure that her crops are irrigated well and her livestock gets enough water for drinking.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: José Luís Baltazar

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad,  es un joven que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, él dice que le hubiese gustado ir a la escuela;  pero no pudo ya que sus padres no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente eta acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos tienen un hijo en común de un año y medio.

José ya tiene dos años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde que se acompañó con su señora, decidió dedicarse a la agricultura ya que no tenía un trabajo, él no tiene terreno propio, trabaja en el terreno de su padre, dice que su hermano le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, le queda cerca el lugar donde va a sembrar el maíz y frijol, su compañera de vida se queda en casa haciendo el oficio de la casa;  pero cuando puede sale ayudarle a él y hace charamuscas en su casa, cuando esta la cosecha de elotes hace tamales para salir a vender y así genera más ingresos que les ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Su horario es de 7 de la mañana a 11 de la mañana, y por las tardes sale a buscar leña para vender.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y la semilla. Él  tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida,  ya que está listo para sembrar, con estas lluvias que ya cayeron dice que ya fue a chapodar y que solo está esperando que su crédito sea aprobado para comprar los fertilizantes que necesita, así dice que se sentirá muy contento,  porque para este año se ha propuesto sembrar más,  ya que este año tiene otra boquita más que alimentar.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando en la milpa para traerles a su familia el pan de cada día, dice que sueña con que su hijo un día sea un maestro y les enseñe a los demás que se quedaron como él sin saber leer ni escribir.
texts.en:
José is a 24 year old who never had the opportunity to study. He says that he would have liked to go to school but his parents couldn't give him that opportunity. He is in a common-law relationship and his wife does domestic work. They have one child together who is one year and a half old.

José has been farming for two years now. Since he got married he decided to farm as before he had no work. He does not have his own land, he works his father's land. He says that his brother taught him how to farm. The land is close to his house and he grows corn and beans. His wife stays at home doing the housework but she goes out to help him when she can. She makes charamuscas (a type of candy) in the house and when it is harvest time she makes tamales and goes out and sells them to generate more income to pay for the household expenses.

José's timetable is from 7 am until 11am and in the afternoons he goes out to look for wood to sell. The loan he is requesting is to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide and seeds. He will have the opportunity to improve his quality of living. It is time to seed and with the rains already falling he says it is time to clear the fields. He is only waiting for the loan to be approved to buy the fertilizers he needs. He says that he will feel very content as this year he proposes to plant more as they have another mouth to feed. His dreams are that God gives him the time to continue to work his corn fields to earn the daily bread for his family. He dreams that one day his son will be a teacher and teach those who do not know how to read and write.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 62 years old. He is married and together they have been blessed with four children. He has four dependents and one employee. He has been in the rental business for 24 years. His secondary businesses are an equity agency and tailoring.

He would like to add rental houses by building five iron sheet houses and would like a loan of KES 100,000. He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 35,000. 

He anticipates that with his profits, he will build more rental houses. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans. In the future, he dreams of building permanent rental houses.

loans.use: to build five iron sheet houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 48 years old. She is married and together have been blessed with six children. She has been in the grocery business for 24 years. She would like to expand her secondary businesses, which are the rearing of cattle and crop farming 

She has applied for a loan of KES 10,000 through which she will buy more fruits for selling to customers in her area. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 12,500. 

She anticipates that through her profits, she will expand her business and elevate her family living standards, through education and providing of food.

loans.use: to buy fruits, such as bananas and pawpaws for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock in larger quantities, including rice, cooking oil, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler of green bananas and educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Saturnino engages in agriculture and livestock breeding. He has several plots of land where he plants potatoes, barley, wheat, and other crops. Saturnino is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress).

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy fertilizers. Saturnino appreciates and values this loan, so he promises to complete his monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. She has one adult dependent and as well as one employee. She has been in the tailoring business for seven years now and the business is doing well. She has one employee with whom she works. 

She would like to improve her business by buying more materials for tailoring like fabric and wool. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 15,800.  She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more fabric materials.

Through her anticipated profits, she will take her child to school and expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials like fabric and wool

loans.name: Artsruni

texts.en: Artsruni lives with his large family in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. He achieved higher education with a specialty in engineering, and he has worked in this field for several years. Now he is a watchman at the village school. Artsruni has a very nice spouse and four children. Two daughters are grown up and greatly help their parents. His elder son is works in the Russian Federation and transfers money to supports his family members. Artsruni has two cows, a calf, a heifer, two piglets, fourteen sheep and 30 chickens on his farm. From his farm he sells milk, macun (Armenia’s national dairy product), eggs and mutton. Artsruni wants to take care of his big family properly, and that is why he wants to enlarge his farm. He is applying for this loan in order to buy a heifer and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Haykuhi

texts.en: Haykuhi is 42 years old and lives in Yerevan city. She has a higher pedagogical education and for eight years, she worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. Now she changed the profile of her work; she is an accountant for a private company. Haykuhi is married. Her husband worked at the Tax Inspectorate, but now he changed his work and he works as an economist at the State Administrative Body. They have two sons; their elder son is a student at the paid division of Yerevan State Economical Institute in the faculty of Accountancy and Audit. Their second son is still school-aged. Haykuhi says that it is time to pay for their son's education, but they have numerous financial problems in their family and with all that, she is afraid that they will not manage to solve that problem. She asks for this loan in order pay for her son’s tuition fee for two semesters.

loans.use: to pay for their son's education

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Gladys, a farmer living in Nyamira, in South Nyanza region. She loves farming, especially poultry farming, and she has been doing it for the past five years. She is married and has three children. Her major sources of income are selling eggs, tea, and bananas, and a personal retail business. In farming, her greatest challenge is limited funds for expanding her poultry farm.

Gladys took up this loan, because she wants to get more poultry for her farm. The poultry will increase her egg production, and hence there will be more income for her and her family to enjoy a good life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is aged 32 years and single. He sells clothes, and he has done this for many years. He has requested a loan to buy more styles of clothes to sell. With the profits from the business, he will make more savings. He is very happy with the previous loan, which helped in making more investment.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zibiya

texts.en: Zibiya is 40 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes, carrots and eggplants for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, eggplant and carrots for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a forty-four year old female. She sells sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap, and she also earns a monthly salary. She sells to the general public. She is accessing a loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap to sell. As a loving mother Oliver, hopes educate her children even though she is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more gari (processed cassava), palm oil and other of foodstuffs and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more waxed cotton, lace and other kinds of fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cream, baby oil and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Tamaraneh group, who are from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Mohamed is the featured leader of this group. The 42-year-old is married to a businesswoman, and they have two children. Mohamed has been a businessman for eight years, now. He sells cloth (Gara cloth and Bamako cloth). With his share of this loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale, to add to his current ones.

(Posing on the left of the photo is Loan Officer Edward).

loans.use: to buy cloth in large numbers for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from a rental house. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children and build a permanent business premise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes on a retail basis. She sells her clothes on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to get a permanent business premise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Julia Rosalvina

texts.es: Julia Rosalvina se dedica a enseñar pues es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad donde vive, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues va pagar los alimentos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Julia Rosalvina is a teacher and works at one of the schools in the city where she lives. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress).

Julia is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use, which she will use to buy food. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy food for personal consumption.

loans.name: Marlis

texts.es:
Una  sonrisa cálida y vibrante es lo primero que te recibe al poner un pie en la pequeña pulpería de Marlis,  la cual se complementa con un ambiente agradable y  productos de calidad, día a día gana más clientes. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. Hace un año inicio su negocio a partir de una liquidación obtenida en su trabajo anterior, anhelaba un negocio propio para obtener más ingresos. Su esposo y su suegra, le han brindado apoyo incondicional en el cumplimiento de sus metas.
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar su capital de negocio, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles, también aceite, golosinas, productos escolares, gaseosas, entre otros. Marlis deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, con el que logrará obtener más ganancias, lo que le permitirá brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y un futuro prospero. Su principal fuente de inspiración es su hijo, a quién desea brindarle educación de calidad. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar una refrigeradora grande y así lograr vender carne y pollo.
texts.en:
A warm vibrant smile is the first thing that welcomes customers upon setting foot inside the small store owned by Marlis. A friendly atmosphere and quality products help to complement the experience. As a result, she gains more customers each day. Marlis is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She started this business a year ago after receiving severance pay from her previous job. Marlis hoped to have her own business so that she could obtain more income. Her husband and mother-in-law provide her unconditional support so that she can accomplish her goals.

Marlis is requesting a loan in order to increase the capital of her business. She wants to buy basic staples, such as rice and beans, but also oil, snack foods, school supplies, sodas, and other products. Marlis places her trust in this loan so that she can generate more earnings. This will enable her to provide her family better living conditions and a prosperous future. Her main source of inspiration is her son, for whom she wants to provide a quality education. One of her future plans is to buy a larger refrigerator so that she can sell meat and chicken.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, snack foods, school supplies, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Nabweru Hard Workers Group

texts.en:
Robertford, a resident of Nabweru Kasawe, a city suburb, is aged 54 and not married. He has two children; both of them are schooling. Robertford has been in the business for the last two years. As a father of two children, he realized the earnings he was getting were so low, and as a counselor, it could not be enough to look after his family and also pay school tuition for his children. 

He saved some money, and in 2010 began a business of supplying matooke (bananas). He believes he is doing well and has hopes of expanding his business. 

Robertford approached UGAFODE for a loan through the group to add stock in his business. The customers and neighbors describe Robertford as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 57 años de edad vive en  casa propia con su familia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. He earns his living growing corn and beans. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses. 

In order to continue with his work and to give his family a better quality of life, José is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land that appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun lives in the Kulen district of Preah Vihea province. She is now 33 years old, married and has four children. Three of them are in school. In order to support the family, she and her husband depend on their paddy rice farm which helps them earn 18,100 KHR average per day.

She has already completed three loans with VisionFund, which were able to help her a lot in improving her family's living. She is now requesting the fourth one, which she will need to pay for the labor fee in farming rice. She expects that the income will help her with her family expenses such as health care, food and her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for the labor fee in farming rice.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 años y 3 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta ropa y helados como chocobananos y charamuscas desde hace mucho tiempo. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una canaleta para dar salida a las aguas lluvias. Además, desea encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará polines, lamina, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their two children, ages 10 and 3. María has been selling clothes and frozen treats, such as chocolate-covered bananas and ice pops, for quite some time. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a gutter for redirecting rainwater. In addition, she wants to lay down a cement floor in the corridor of her home.

The amount she requested will be used to buy posts, metal sheeting, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a gutter and laying down a cement floor.

loans.name: Ruth Miladey

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO DE ECHARATE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ruth Miladey se dedica al trabajo de administradora en el sector público, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para uso personal para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth Miladey is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntos por El Desarrollo de Echarate” (Together for the Development of Echarate), which is located in the District of Echarate, La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She works as an administrator in the public sector. Her work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Ruth has been in this line of work for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a clothing shop. She is requesting a loan for personal use in order to buy sound equipment for her home.

Ruth is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her home.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 4 children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

She operates a beauty salon from home and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO of Uganda shillings 1,300,000 to buy hair cream relaxers, treatments, shampoo, weaves, braids. Her major business challenge is electricity and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a generator to serve her customers in times of power shortages.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, cream relaxers, shampoo, weaves and braids

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia is 42 years old. She is married with five children. She has been running her business for four years. 


She has applied a loan of KES. 40,000 for renovating her rental houses and buying vegetables to sell to clients. She currently makes a monthly income of KES.33, 500. She would like a loan of KES.40, 000

From her anticipated profits, she will buy goods in bulk. In the future, she wants to ensure that all her children complete higher level education.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses and buy vegetables, like cabbages, to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Meet Jane who is a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza. On her farm, she grows tea, bananas and sugar cane, and rears dairy cows and poultry. She really enjoys working on her farm because it gives back good returns. Her biggest challenges are poor roads and lack of good markets.

Jane has taken out a Kiva loan with Juhudi Kilimo because they meet the financial needs of their clients and they are client-friendly. She states that she will be able to purchase a dairy cow so that she can increase her supply of milk, and this means that she will have more income. This will ensure that she will be able to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 23 years old, is married and supports two people in his family. He runs a retail shop in Kipsimo trading centre in Nandi County. Abraham has been in business for the last two years: he earns an average monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Abraham plans to use the borrowed amount of KES 30,000 to pay school fees for his siblings. He will use the profits from his retail shop business to sustain himself and his dependants.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a thirty year-old male. He deals in cattle fattening along a busy street. Stephen started this business to earn a living and sells to the people living in and around his town. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to have more product to sell. Stephen wishes to have a better shelter for his family but has been challeneged by inconsistent income.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Bethleem 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Carlène is a member of the group BETHLEEM 2 (1) and has been running a small imported foods business out of her home the last four years. As a mother of two small children, Carlène would like to continue to grow her business. 

As the leader of a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, Carlène would like to take out a small loan of 350,000 to invest in her business. With this money, Carlène would be able to reinforce her stock of fruit, oil, sugar and other non-perishable goods, as well as branch out to selling dried fish. 

Since starting with HOPE Congo in 2012, Carlène is now on her seventh loan cycle. Carlène dreams of being able to open her own clothing store in future after gradually building up her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, oil, sugar and other non-perishable goods, as well as branch out to selling dried fish

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is forty-four years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is a carpenter. Baker started business in order to support his family. 

Baker dreams of eradicating illiteracy by providing education to his children.

Baker is a hardworking man who needs a loan to buy timber to make furniture to selling.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture to selling.

loans.name: Scarleth Vanessa

texts.es:
La diversidad de idiomas, los negocios y los viajes alrededor del mundo, desde niña motivaron a Scarleth para optar por la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales. Ella tiene 19 años de edad, está soltera y cursa segundo año de la carrera. Su tía le ha brindado apoyo en sus actividades escolares, al mismo tiempo recibe ayuda de las remesas que le envían sus padres, las que que le proporcionan estabilidad económica. Es una joven emprendedora, carismática y con visión de futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora portátil, puesto que con el avance de la tecnología urge la necesidad de cumplir con las responsabilidades y obligaciones a través del Internet y Scarleth no quiere quedarse atrás, quiere aprovechar todas las herramientas que favorezcan su profesión y ser la número uno. Aspira a ser una profesional de éxito y laborar en lo que más le apasiona, su carrera. Una de sus próximas metas, es obtener un carro, que el facilite transportarse de un lugar a otro.
texts.en:
Ever since she was a child the diversity of languages, business, and worldwide travel motivated Scarleth to choose the field of International Relations. She is 19 years old, single, and is in the second year of her degree. Her aunt has provided support for her studies and she also gets financial help from her parents who provide her with financial stability. 

She is an enterprising, charismatic young woman with a vision for the future. She is asking for the loan so she can buy a laptop computer because technological advances make this a necessity for her to meet her responsibilities and requirements via the Internet, and she does not want to be left behind. She wants to use of all the tools that are available to her profession and be number one. 

She aspires to be a successful professional and do work that she is passionate about - her field. One of her next goals is to get a car to help her get from one place to another.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Chiedza from Gokwe. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school.  Chiedza runs a retail business selling groceries, clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenges that she faces are low sales during some summer periods. 

Chiedza has requested a loan of US$800 to buy jackets, tracksuits, footwear, sugar, rice and flour to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her sales and therefore her disposable income. In the future, Chiedza plans to own her shop building.

loans.use: to buy jackets, tracksuits, footwear, sugar, rice and flour to sell

loans.name: Andres Fernando

texts.es:
Él es Andrés Fernando, tiene 21 años, está interesado en estudiar culinaria, para un futuro mejor de él y el de la familia, él se quiere dar el estudio por los propios medios, después de que sea graduado como auxiliar, va a seguir estudiando para ser chef profesional, gracias a la oportunidad de campo alto, el desea ser un experto en la cocina y conocer con propiedad los productos, la administración, la contabilidad y el mayor valor de la nutrición. 

En este momento necesita el convenio, ya que la estabilidad económica no es muy buena, después de ser un experto en la cocina puede conseguir un trabajo formal y así brindarle mejor vida a la familia.
texts.en:
This is Andrés Fernando. He is 21 years old and interested in studying culinary arts so that he and his family can have a better future. Andrés wants to study through his own means. After graduating from the assistant’s program, he wants to continue studying in order to become a professional chef thanks to the opportunity from CampoAlto. Andrés wants to become an expert at cooking and gain knowledge in product ownership, management, accounting, and nutritional value.

At the moment he needs a loan since his financial stability is not very good. After he becomes an expert at cooking, he wants to secure a formal job and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta se dedica a enseñar pues es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad donde vive, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal para pagar la educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Violeta is a teacher and works at one of the schools in the city where she lives. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress).

Violeta is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use in order to pay for her children’s education. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, blankets, and other supplies.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, aged 24, is a young and energetic man who, at a young age, has ventured into farming, something that most young people do not deem necessary. He has practised farming for the past five years where he produces and sells milk, eggs and a few crops. Vincent enjoys this very much because he says that he enjoys selling his farm produce. His biggest challenge is that the cost of farming is very high.

Vincent chose Juhudi Kilimo for this Kiva loan because they understand the needs of smallholder farmers and the interest rate on the loan is low. With this loan, he will purchase a dairy cow for more efficient milk production. He says that the income will help take care of his two children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana trabaja en el área de administración en una entidad del estado, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como gastos de educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Roxana works in the field of administration in a state entity.  She was invited to participate in Camino al Progreso Communal Bank because she's a responsible person.

Roxana needs this loan for personal use for her children's school expenses.

She's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses

loans.name: Bethleem 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Ursula is a mother of three and is a member of a community bank group called BETHLEEM 2 (2). Heading up a sub-group of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo, Ursula runs her own perfume shop and would like to continue to grow her business. In order to do so, Ursula needs a loan of 250,000 CFA to purchase additional beauty products such as perfumes, deodorants and lotions to sell. 

Ursula is now on her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo since joining BETHLEEM 2 (2) last year. One day she hopes to be able to travel to China to purchase goods to sell in Brazzaville. With two children still going through school, Ursula dreams of continuing to support her family by being able to purchase a piece of land and build them a home.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products such as perfume, lotion and deodorant to sell

loans.name: Salomon (2) Group

texts.en:
Augustine is the mother of five children and runs a small diverse merchandise business out of her home. Always thinking of more activities to help support her family, Augustine sells a bit of everything: gasoline, manioc (cassava), fruit and fish and she even makes small cakes, called brioches, to sell. As a member of the community bank group Salomon (2), Augustine helps lead a subgroup of eleven other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville in the Republic of Congo. 

Now on her fifth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Augustine wants to take out a loan of 250,000 Central African CFA franks to purchase additional flour and sugar for her cakes and expand to purchasing fish from Point Noir, a coastal city in the Republic of Congo. Augustine dreams of purchasing her own piece of land, where she could build a home for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional flour and sugar for her cakes and expand to purchasing fish

loans.name: My God (2) Group

texts.en:
Alexandre runs a small diverse goods shop selling items such as oil, rice, mayo and biscuits. He is a member of the group MY GOD (2), and leads the group of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. 

An experienced vendor, Alexandre started out with just a small market kiosk and now has his own shop. Alexandre would like to purchase additional merchandise to sell at his shop through taking out a loan of 400,000 CFA with HOPE Congo.

Alexandre first joined HOPE Congo in 2012, and is currently on his sixth loan cycle. He hopes to be able to continue to grow his business and continue supporting his family. 

The father of three children, Alexandre hopes that they will one day be able to grow up to work jobs of their own. Through growing his business, Alexandre dreams of being able to buy his own property and build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bottles of oil, rice, mayonnaise and buscuits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients such as pepper, fish, meat, onions, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and native rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Las Joyas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Joyas” (The Jewels) are applying for a second loan cycle through KIVA. Their goal is to sustain and expand their small businesses. The ladies are enormously grateful to KIVA investors who financed their first loan cycle. Happily, the loans were repaid fully and on time. The women are hopeful that KIVA investors will fund this new loan cycle.

Rosa Leticia was featured in the first loan cycle and we are pleased to report that, because of her loan, her business has improved.  Production, sales and income have increased for her, and her family has realized benefits, as well. Rosa Leticia sends greetings and great appreciation to KIVA investors.

In this report, we would like to feature another client, Angelica. She is a 31-year-old married woman with four children who range in age from 16 months to 13 years of age. Because of her leadership skills, Angelica was named President of the Trust Bank, a position that she is happy to occupy. The ladies in the Trust Bank are very responsible and Angelica is certain that this next loan cycle will be most successful. 

Angelica has a thriving textile business. She buys and sells beautiful, traditional skirts called “cortes”. A “corte” is a long piece of fabric, at least six yards in length, that is wrapped around the waist and then secured with an ornate woven belt. Each village has its own unique design. Angelica is requesting a new loan in order to purchase more “cortes” to meet the demands of her customers. She intends to purchase a wider variety of designs and will be certain to only have high quality “cortes” for sale. Angelica is pleased that she generates enough income to keep three of her children in school and wants them to continue through college.

The Trust Bank “Las Joyas” acknowledges the generosity and support of KIVA investors. The ladies are quite motivated to maintain and expand their small businesses. Most of all, they look forward to providing their children with a better and more prosperous future. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase more “cortes” to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 43 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, Don Francisco tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 43-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and their five children. Francisco has farmed for over 20 years and specializes in growing corn and beans. He has a great deal of valuable experience that helps him achieve the best harvests. Francisco's land is part of an agricultural region and he sells his crops in all of the neighboring towns, where he has many steady customers. These customers prefer Francisco's crops because he offers high-quality produce at reasonable price, and with unmatched service. 

Francisco wants to invest in farming supplies but needs capital to do this. He has therefore applied for a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can purchase  purchase seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, fungicide, tools, pesticides, and other supplies. This investment will allow Francisco to improve the land shown in this photo. Don Francisco has positive references from other creditors and is certain he will be able to pay off this new loan on time. He is also confident that he'll be able to provide his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, fungicide, tools, pesticides, and other supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Selvin Rolando

texts.es: Selvin de 37 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol. Selvin  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Selvin, 37, is a very responsible man with his household obligations.  He has always been known for giving his family the best.  Currently he lives with his family.  He's very hardworking and always works happily and enthusiastically.

Selvin earns a living as a farmer.  His main crops are corn and beans.

Selvin wants to increase his sales, so he went to the Integral offices to request a loan to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and other supplies to improve his plot of land, which is shown in the photograph.

He wants to have the help requested because he has no other financial income.  That way he'll keep on supporting his family on a daily basis with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and other supplies

loans.name: Trabajando Para  El Futuro Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Trabajando Para El Futuro” conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas, que cada día luchan por salir adelante con el único propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de Evelyn que biene desempeñandose como secretaria  en una empresa de transportes. Comenzó hace mas de 03 años donde todo le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de apoyar a sus padres en su negocio de abarrotes.  Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite. Evelyn de 24 años de edad es soltera.  El grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Evelyn se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior  es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo manga larga de color celeste.
texts.en:
This is the“Trabajando Para El Futuro” [Working for the Future] communal bank which is made up of seven enterprising and hard-working women who struggle every day to get ahead. Their sole purpose is to ensure the well-being of their families. 

This is the case of Evelyn who is 24 years old and single and works as a secretary for a transportation company. She started more than three years ago and it has been going well for her. Her greatest desire is to lend support to her parents with their grocery store and this is why she has asked for a loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

The group "Trabajando Para El Futuro" thanks the people who made this loan possible. Evelyn is standing in the back and is the first one on the right with a sky-blue, long-sleeve shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia se dedica a enseñar  y trabaja como docente en un colegio de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como gastos de educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sonia makes a living as a teacher and she works in a school in the city of Paucartambo.  She was invited to participate in Camino al Progreso Communal Bank because she's a responsible person.

Sonia needs this loan for personal use for her children's school expenses.

She's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to pay her children's school expenses

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: Vicentina se dedica a la venta de autopartes de automóviles, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar pistones, llantas, aceites, grasa y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vicentina makes a living selling car parts.  She was invited to join Camino al Progreso Communal Bank because she's a responsible person.

She needs this loan to buy pistons, tires, oil, grease, and other items.

Vicentina's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy pistons, tires, oil, grease, and other items

loans.name: Salomon (1) Group

texts.en:
Raïssa runs a small business selling diverse food and material goods out of her home. The sole parent of her eight-year-old daughter, Raïssa also supports her parents through her business activities. 

As a member of the community bank group Salomon (1), Raïssa would like to take out a small loan of 250,000 Central African (CFA) franks to invest in her business. With her loan, Raïssa would purchase additional oil, rice, sugar and gasoline to sell. Leading a group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo, Raïssa is currently on her third loan cycle with HOPE Congo.

In the future, Raïssa hopes to open her own food goods shop and eventually branch out into other businesses, such as a butcher’s shop. She dreams of her daughter being able to finish school well and eventually go on to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional oil, rice, sugar and gasoline to sell

loans.name: La Puissance 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Dorothée is member of the community bank group LA PUISSANCE 2 (2) and leads a small subgroup of eight micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. For over 15 years, Dorothée has worked hard to support her only son, which became even more difficult after losing her husband. Dorothée runs her own restaurant and drink stand, and would like to take out a loan of 350,000 CFA to purchase additional drinks, fish, chicken and other meats to grill. 

Dorothée opens up shop early and closes late, working hard to serve as many clients as possible. In the future Dorothée would like to expand her business to include more drinks, and also branch out into a second activity: selling fabric, or pagnes. She hopes to one day be able to build her own home with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional drinks, fish, chicken and other meats to grill

loans.name: My God (1) Group

texts.en:
