texts.en: José is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their three children, ages 18, 15, and 10. José makes his living in agriculture and also works in the nearby market hauling packages to different vendors. José asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of walls for a room, for which he will need materials such as galvanized metal sheets and wood. His living conditions are very humble.

loans.use: to purchase: galvanized metal sheets and wood to build the walls for a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger cooler to be able to stock more products and replace the existing one that is in bad shape

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It is 44 years old and married. She has three school-going children. It has no school degree because of the family’s economic limit. For many years she has been engaged in agriculture, primarily farming rice and raising birds, to earn a living. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to improve the area of rice production and cover her family’s living costs. In addition to agribusiness, It also owns a grocery store where she sells mixed merchandise to local people.

Since her stock of merchandise is decreasing, It would like to restore it again in order to sustain her business. That’s why she is taking out a loan to buy grocery products such as sweets, soft drinks, ingredients, snacks, packed food, and other miscellaneous things. It anticipates having a better income from this investment and to certainly bolster her family’s finances.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as sweets, soft drinks, ingredients, snacks, packed food, and other miscellaneous things.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela se dedica a la venta de frutas  y verduras como por ejemplo papaya, manzanas, plátanos, cebollas, piñas, naranjas y otros,  ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Manuela works selling fruits and vegetables such as papaya, apples, bananas, onions, pineapple, oranges, and others. She is a responsible person, and for this reason they invited her to participate in the communal bank "Camino al Progreso." This time, she needs a loan to purchase vegetables and fruit. The is thankful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar se dedica a enseñar porque es profesor y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la cuidad de Paucartambo, él es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal para la luz eléctrica de su hogar, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julio Cesar makes a living as a teacher and works in one of the high schools in the city of Paucartambo. He is a responsible person. For this reason, he was invited to participate in the communal bank "Camino al Progreso" and, at this time, he is in need of a loan for personal use in order to pay for electricity in his home. Julio Cesar is grateful for the loan and pledges to make all of the repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to pay for electricity.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, puesto que desde que estaba en el colegio, trabaja conjuntamente con su madre para ganar algún dinero para comprar objetos personales o caprichos que los jóvenes tanto se antojaban en ese tiempo, al pasar el tiempo y una vez salida del colegio se empleó en una empresa de confecciones, la cual quebró y le ofreció a Jenny maquinaria para que iniciara su propio negocio y es desde el año 2000 que es una persona independiente, trabaja junto a una empleada en el negocio ubicado en su casa y el volumen de su trabajo es constante en el año por lo que le da gracias a dios por esa bendición que recibió, necesita un crédito para el arreglo del motor de una de sus máquinas y la compra de tela para vender su línea propia de ropa que la vende en pocas cantidades y por pedido su mayor aspiración es poder terminar de pagar los estudios profesionales de su hija y terminar el 3 piso de su casa el cual le traerá un ingreso extra a la hora de alquilarlo
texts.en: Jenny is a woman very dedicated to her work, as since she was in secondary school, she worked with her mother to earn some money to buy personal items or the things that young people fancy at that time to pass the time. Once she left school, she worked in a dressmaking shop, which went bankrupt and they offered Jenny the machinery to open her own business and since the year 2000, she has been an independent person. She works with an employee in the business located in her home and the work volume is constant throughout the year, for which she thanks God for this blessing that she received. She needs a loan to fix the motor on one of her machines and to purchase fabric to sell her own line of clothing that she sells to order in small quantities. Her greatest goal is to be able to pay for her daughter's professional studies and to complete the third floor of her house, which will bring in extra income when she can rent it out.

loans.use: to repair a flat sewing machine and to purchase sock for her own line of clothing that she sells to order

loans.name: Eduardo Alfonso

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven de 21 años de edad quien habita junto a su madre. Desde hace 4 años Eduardo se gana la vida por medio del comercio de variedad de ropa como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc. Eduardo es un joven visionario quien desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda antes de que llegue el invierno dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Eduardo 21-year-old young man who lives with his mother. For the past 4 years, Eduardo has made his living by selling a variety of clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, blouses, underwear, etc. Eduardo is a visionary young man who wishes to improve his living conditions and has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets and wood to repair the roof of his home before winter arrives since it is deteriorating.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria Luz se dedica a la venta de jugos y refrescos, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo frutas, azúcar, plantas medicinales, tortas, gelatinas y otras cosas más,  ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Maria Luz works selling juices and soft drinks. She is a responsible person and for this reason was invited to participate in the "Camino al Progreso" communal bank. On this occasion, she needs a loan to purchase supplies such as fruits, sugar, medicinal plants, cakes, jellies and other items. She is thankful for and values the loan and promises to responsibly make the monthly payments

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fruit, sugar, medicinal plants, cakes, jellies and other items.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabala est une femme ambitieuse et dirigeante du groupe Mavuno. Agée de 40ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle débuta ses activités depuis 1997. Le prêt sollicite lui servira d’acheter  62 paires de souliers usagés.  Elle rêve l’expansion  de ses activités, l’amélioration de son habitat et assurer  la scolarité de ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour la promotion des  femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Kabala is an ambitious women and the leader of the Mavuno group. She is 40 years old, married to a business man, and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She began her commercial activity in 1997. This loan will allow her to purchase 62 pairs of used shoes. She dreams of expanding her business, improving her living living conditions and ensuring the education of her children. She is grateful to Hekima for their support of women with low-incomes.

loans.use: purchase 62 pairs of secondhand shoes

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products and accessories, like bags made of beads and the like, to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennifer still hopes of having an established and growing business and dreams of giving her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Rudylita

texts.en:
Rudylita has helped her husband in managing their own farm for 12 years, earning well for the family. Her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the next planting season.

Rudylita is hoping to yield higher returns from her farm and wants to sustain and improve it for a stable source of income in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Murhula Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankavu est  une femme entrepreneur, présidente de l’association de crédit Murhula. Elle est âgée de 38 ans, mère de 9 enfants et mariée à un homme sans travail. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter  15 sacs de braises. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et y construire une très belle maison. Elle remercie Hekima de faciliter les transactions commerciales aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Nankavu is an entrepreneur, and the president of the Murhula group. She is 38 years old, the mother of 9 children and married to a man who does not work. She is asking for another loan in order to purchase 15 bags of embers. She hopes, in the future, to purchase a plot of land and build a very nice home. She would like to thank Hekima for facilitating commercial transactions for women with low incomes.

loans.use: purchase 15 bags of embers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to adapt and carry out modifications to his fast food stall and buy supplies such as meat, potatoes, bread, wrappers and serviettes.

loans.name: La Fontaine Group

texts.fr: Madame Mawazo, femme  ambitieuse  est  présidente  de  la micro entreprise La fontaine. Commerçante depuis 1990 ; âgée de 50 ans ; elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont  10 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle sollicite un nouveau  prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter 300 poissons.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur de lui permettre d’accroitre son activité, nourrir ses enfants, scolariser ses enfants et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Ms Mawazo, an ambitious woman, is the president of the micro enterprise La Fontaine. Involved in commercial activity since 1990, and currently 50 years old, she is married to a business man and together they have 10 children, all of whom attend school. She is asking for another loan in order to purchase 300 fish. She is deeply thankful to Hekima for enabling her to increase her activity, which allows her to feed and educate her children, and she prays for their

loans.use: purchase 300 fish

loans.name: Srim

texts.en:
Srim lives in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She is 28 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children attend school, while the youngest child is only three years old. Her family's living depends mainly on the paddy rice farm. She earns 3,4000 KHR on average per day.

Srim has completed three loans with VisionFund already. She is now requesting her fourth one. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the paddy rice field. She will use the income to cover family expenses such as her children's education, the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two machines to cover the orders and provide work for two people.

loans.name: Jungie

texts.en: Jungie is operating a farm raising crops and planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. For many years, Jungie earned well from the farm and was able to provide sufficiently for the needs of his family. His previous loan from GDMPC that he used for farming was successfully repaid. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer such as manure.  He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
A son of a fisherman, Jerome, 18 years old from Dipaculao, Aurora, is keen to help his family to have a more stable life. 

Jerome already completed high school but was not able to pursue college because of financial problems. He wants to take a microfinance technology course so that he can land a job after he graduates. 

With this loan of PHP 40,000, he will be able to enroll in college and start chasing success.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 32 years old with one child and is a single mother. She raises her own daughter with determination and is hard-working for the future of her daughter. She has a small plot of farmland that she has managed for five years. In order to cater for the needs of her daughter, she is asking for a loan amounting to Php 30,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farm business.

In the future, Marilou hopes that she can supply all the needs of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farm business.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es: John un humilde campesino que ocupo unos previos que le dejaron sus padres la fallecer, se ha dedicado toda la vida al campo y al hablar con el podemos reflejar su amor por el campo pro esta tan respetada pero tan marginada profesión, no solo ejerce la profesión de cultivador también es un mayordomo en fincas cercanas, es un hombre que de verdad le gusta trabajar, tiene cultivo de café, plátano y yuca los cuales distribuye a vecinos y en la plaza de mercado, solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como pesticidas, semillas, fungicidas, adecuara una parte del terreno para sembrar más árboles y en la mano de la obra del proyecto con los que espere tener trabajo para toda la vida, morir en su tierra trabajando y siempre velando por su esposa e hijo que son los que le dan motivación y fuerza diariamente para trabajar
texts.en:
John is a humble man of the countryside who has taken over some previously worked land that his parents left him when they passed away. He has dedicated his whole life to farming, and in talking to him, one sees reflected his love for the countryside and for this highly respected but also marginalized profession. 

He not only pursues the profession of cultivator but also is a manager of nearby farms. He is a man who truly enjoys working. He grows coffee, plantains and yuca, which he sells to neighbors and in the town marketplace. 

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as pesticides, seeds, and fungicides, and to prepare a part of his land to plant more trees, paying for labor needed for the project. With this, he hopes to have work for the rest of his life and to continue working on his land until he dies, always taking care of his wife and his son, who give him the motivation and energy to work each day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee, plantains and yuca, and pay for employees

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 17 años de edad de los cuales el mayor asiste al colegio, Elisa se dedica a criar chanchos desde hace 5 años y también trabaja en el campo, Elisa vive juntamente con su padre y sus hijos en la casa que es propiedad de su padre, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos que los va a tener en una chanchera, su sueño es tener más chanchos para mejorar este negocio  y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos para que no les falte dinero a sus hijos para que estudien y darles la alimentación.
texts.en:
Elisa is a single mother with two children aged 3 and 17. The older one goes to school. She lives with her parents and her children in the house belonging to her father.

For the last 5 years Elisa has made a living raising pigs and she also works in the fields.

She will use the loan to buy pigs which she will keep in a pigsty. Her dream is to have more pigs so she can improve this business and so improve her income, so that there will be enough money to feed her children and to give them an education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena earns well from her general store where she has been selling assorted groceries for six years.

She used her previous loan for the business and has successfully repaid it. 

She wants to offer more goods and now she is taking another loan to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell. She always maintains good relations with her customers and wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: Madame Zula  est une femme créative, d’une grande expérience et  membre du groupe de credit Ushindi.  Agée de 61 ans, elle est  mariée à un chômeur et mère de 6 enfants dont seulement 2 vont à l’école. Elle demande ce nouveau credit  pour lui permettre d’acheter  1 ballot de soulier usagé. Elle souhaite la prospérité de ses affaires et rêve de devenir grossiste. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour la promotion des femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Zula is a member of the Ushindi Group and an experienced and creative woman.  She is 61 years old and married to an unemployed man.  They have six children but only two of them attend school.

Zula has requested this loan in order to be able to buy a parcel of second-hand shoes.  She would like her business to be successful and dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

Zula is grateful to the field partner, Hekima, for their promotion of economically active, poor women.

loans.use: to buy 1 parcel of second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sokum

texts.en:
Sokum is living in Phnom Srouch district located in Kompong Speu province. She is 28 years old and married. She has four children, age 7, 5, 3 and 1 year old, living with her. The primary income for the whole family comes from farming. In total, Sokum’s family makes an average monthly income of only 322,000 KHR.

This is the forth microloan for Sokum with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully repaid the past loan and it was a very generous blessing for her children that allowed them to have enough food and to go to school. Now, she is seeking another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for crops. She optimistically believes that the loan will help her to generate more income in order to have enough support for her four children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es: No es de sorprenderse encontrar una mujer ya de avanzada edad trabajando y es que no se le puede pedir a un colombiano que este en su casa cuando las oportunidades están en la calle y es así como trabaja María una vendedora ambulante de ropa que ha trabajo 35 años en esta actividad la cual ejercieron sus padres y le cedieron los conocimientos a ella, María se ha enfrentado a muchos problemas en la vida pero uno que la aqueja últimamente es el cuidado de su hija pues es una hermosa especial que sufre de una enfermedad que no al deja desarrollarse normalmente, por ello El principal sueño de María es adecuar su negocio en la casa no pro que se sienta cansada pues es una insaciable mujer con un deseo interminable de dar sus años de vida a favor de su hija, si no que quiere estar siempre al cuidado de ella, solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con jeans, blusas, ropa de hombre y dama en general.
texts.en:
It's not surprising to find a woman of advanced years still working and it's not possible to ask a Colombian to stay at home when there are opportunities on the street. This is why María works as a street vendor selling clothing and has been doing this for 35 years. Her parents were in this line of work and they passed their knowledge on to her.

María has had to face many problems in life, but the one which has been worrying her recently is having to look after her daughter, who is a special beautiful girl who suffers from an illness which prevents her from developing normally. Therefore, María's main dream is to set up her business in her home, not because she feels tired- since she is an insatiable woman with an unending desire to give the years of her life to support her daughter- but because she wants to be able to look after her daughter all the time.

She is asking for a loan to stock her business with jeans, blouses and men's and ladies' clothing in general.

loans.use: to stock her business with jeans, blouses and men's and ladies' clothing in general.

loans.name: Marta Nelly

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 58 años dedicada a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas. Tiene un pequeño carro en el cual realiza sus recetas y atiende con gusto a sus clientes.
Todos los ingresos de su negocio son destinados a la manutención de su madre ya que ella es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora.
Ella desea hacerle una revolución a su negocio y requiere ayuda para comprar una carpa y sillas, de esta forma atenderá a sus clientes de una manera mas cómoda y con mejor servicio. Adicional a esto comprara insumos e ingredientes para realizar sus recetas y tener siempre los alimentos a disposición de sus clientes.
Su mayor desafío es la competencia tan grande que hay en el sector con negocios del mismo tipo.
texts.en:
Marta is a woman of 58 who works preparing and selling fast foods. She has a small cart which she uses to prepare her recipes and enthusiastically serve her customers.

All of the income from her business is used to support her mother, since she is single and has no children. She is an enterprising and very hard-working woman. 

She has the desire to give her business a makeover, and she needs help to buy a canopy and chairs. In this way she will be able to serve her customers in a more comfortable manner and provide better service. In addition to this, she will buy supplies and ingredients to prepare her recipes, so that she will always have food to offer her customers. 

Her greatest challenge is the very heavy competition existing in this field among businesses of the same type.

loans.use: to buy a canopy, chairs and ingredients for the food she prepares.

loans.name: Phor

texts.en:
Phor, age 41, has been growing and harvesting rice as her primary source of income and has had this business for nearly 20 years. With the income from rice production, Phor is able to sustain their living as well as improving her farm. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to cover her living costs and support her children in their education.

Phor is taking out a loan to add to her existing capital in order to make home improvements because her house, which has been built for years, has deteriorated and badly needs to be fixed. She and her family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Rhina Concepcion

texts.es: Rhina tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 18 años y 4 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Rhina trabaja como operaria en una empresa cercana a su localidad y de esta forma se gana la vida y trata de dar lo necesario a su familia. Rhina desea construir la pared de su vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado y desea dar mayor seguridad a sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de adobes (elaborados a base de lodo) y para pagar la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en:
Rhina is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her two children, aged 18 and 4. They both go to the local State school. Rhina works as an operative in a company near to where she lives and this is how she earns a living and tries to give her family everything they need.

Rhina wants to build the wall of her home as it is in a poor condition and she wants to make it safer for her children. For this reason she is asking FUSAI for this loan to buy adobe bricks (made from mud) and to pay for labour for the construction.

loans.use: to buy adobe bricks and pay for labour to build the wall of the house.

loans.name: Rosmito

texts.en:
Rosmito is a very hard-working man who lives in Delfin Albano and has been in his line of work for 9 years, which has allowed him to get ahead in life and cover his expenses. He plants different kinds of crops, like corn, rice and watermelon. This allows him to feed himself as well as sell these products for his subsistence. This is why he puts a lot of hard work and dedication into his work, since his day-to-day progress depends on it.

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy seeds, plant part of his land, and buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his crops and continue to work hard to get ahead in life and make his great dream a reality: to have a larger plot of land to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plant part of his land, and buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Utii Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Ciza, présidente du groupe de crédit Utii, est  âgée de 34 ans. Mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est mère de  6 enfants dont  5 sont scolarisés.  Elle est spécialiste dans les services de restaurant, depuis 2000. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter  20 casiers de boissons alcoolisées. Elle souhaite achever la construction de sa maison et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Enfin, elle bénie Hekima de l’avoir aidé à subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ciza is the president of the loan group 'Utii'.  She is 34 years old and married to a business man.  The couple has six children, of whom five attend school.  Ciza has specialised in the restaurant trade since 2000.  She has requested this loan in order to buy twenty crates of alcoholic drinks.

Ciza would like to complete the construction of her house and provide for the education of her children.  She blesses the field partner, Hekima, for helping her to pay for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 crates of alcoholic drinks for resale.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 50 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store where she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a government employee.
 
Marivic has been three years in this field and she successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business.

She requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits for improvement of her business as well as the general living of her family members.

The story of Marivic and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children. His oldest child will start next year studying at the university. Almost a year ago, he started rice cultivation by renting the plot of a relative. Without ASKI, it would have been impossible for Rommel to start with the rice cultivation, because he had no money to invest. 

He saves the profits of his rice cultivation for the studies of his children. He also wants to have his own piece of land where he can plant rice and take care of his family. He needs a loan of PHP 20,000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laying hens and improve her facility, because her animals are dying on her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Amway products to distribute to more people.

loans.name: Claudioso Enrique

texts.es: Enrique es un joven colombiano que vive 7 años en Ecuador, se dedica 10 años a la elaboración de quesos, comenta que dejo su país natal ya que le contrataron desde Ecuador para que elabore algunas variedades de queso que él sabe elaborar, Enrique vive solo en una cosa por la que paga arriendo, tiene un hijo de 3 años que aunque no vive junto a él si se hace responsable de su vestimenta y alimento, Enrique va a invertir el crédito en la compra de leche para hacer quesos en el negocio que lo integran 3 personas, ahí trabajan los 3 propietarios y tienen 2 empleadas fijas, Enrique aspira contratar a más personas para que le ayuden a mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Enrique is a young Colombian who has lived in Ecuador for 7 years. He has made cheese for 19 years. He says that he left his home country because he heard that he was hired in Ecuador to make several varieties of cheese that he knows how to make. Enrique lives alone in a house that he rents. He has a 3 year old son that he does not live with but he is responsible for his clothing and food. Enrique is going to invest the loan in buying milk to make cheese for the business, made up of three owners and two regular employees. Enrique hopes to hire more people so they can help him improve the business.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de agua, tiene dos hijos, ambos viven con ellos y están estudiando, nadie más vive con ellos.

Ella es ama de casa, pero a la misma ves también se dedica a la agricultura, a pesar que es mujer, eso no le impide en lo absoluto a poder dedicarse a la actividad, desde pequeña su padre la llevaba a los cultivos ya que no habían hermanos barones grandes para que le ayudaran, también es ama de casa, no tiene un negocio al que se dedique, la parcela donde trabajan la tiene a un kilómetro de retirada de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, un hermano es el que más se involucra ya que trabajan juntos, teniendo un horario de trabajo de 6 am a 12 md. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra en donde cultivara.  Hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el apoyo de sus hijos no invierte en personas que le ayuden, pero si en el arrendamiento de la tierra, la mejora será el ir avanzando en los trabajos, y la necesidad satisfecha es el tener su propio capital de trabajo.
  
El poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad del arrendamiento de la tierra.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old. she went to school through the ninth grade. She is married and her husband works in a water distribution company. She has two children and both of them live with them and are in school. Nobody else lives with them. 

She is a housewife and also a farmer. Being a woman does not impede her at all from being able to do this activity. Since she was little, her father would take her to the fields, since she had no older brothers to help . She is also a housewife and has no business she works in. The land parcel she works in is a kilometer from her house and she gets there on foot. A brother is the one who is the most involved and they work together. Their work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 12 noon.  

The loan she is asking for is to pay for the rent of the land where they will grow. Now that winter is coming, with her children's help, she doesn't invest in people to help them, but she does invest in renting the land. The improvement will be getting ahead with the work, and she will have her own working capital. 
 
She wants to always have what her family needs the most, and for that she hopes God will give her health and life. The loan will help her to meed the need of renting the land.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land she will cultivate.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou is residing in the Phnom Srouch district of Kompong Speu province. She is a 44-year-old married woman. 

As a farmer, Hou’s primary income is from selling crops. However, the yield from farming has brought an average daily income of only 8,000 KHR. 

Hou has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the past three cycles. Her past loan has enabled her to uplift the lifestyle of the whole family, and she has successfully repaid it. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizers for her cash crop. She strongly hopes that she can boost her crop yield timely so that she can earn more income to maintain an appropriate lifestyle for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is a resident of the Ksach Kandal district located in the Kandal province. She is a 53-year-old married woman. Ny has been a butcher for 22 years. The primary source of income for her family is from selling pork.
 
This is the first time that Ny is seeking a microloan from Kiva’s partner, Visionfund. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. With the loan money, Ny will buy more pork to resell. She strongly believes that the loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, will enable her to uplift her lifestyle and have enough food for the family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn is a 29-year-old woman who is residing in the Phnom Srouch district of the Kompong Speu province. Currently, Korn is responsible for her two little children. Farming has been the primary source of income for her family. It earns the family of about 10,000 KHR daily which is barely enough to feed her children and even herself.

This is the first time that Korn has applied for a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Korn is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes that the money from the loan will uplift her farming business and will allow her to provide her children with appropriate basic needs, mainly enough food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon is a 46-year-old married woman. She is residing in the Phnom Srouch district of the Kampong Speu province. Pon has three children living dependent on her. She has been growing rice. Her family earns an average daily income of only 10,000 KHR. 

This is the first time that Pon has applied for a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the loan money of 1,000,000 KHR, Pon will buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She strongly believes that loan will help her to uplift her family's lifestyle by being able to have money to buy enough food and cover basic expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is a 40-year-old married woman residing in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She has four children. All of her children are dependent on her. Three of her children go to school in the village. 

Thon earns money mainly by selling fish. She has been in this business for 14 years already. The business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

She has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner,VisionFund, for eight cycles already and she has completely repaid the past loans. In this ninth cycle, Thon is applying for a microloan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She strongly believes that the loan money will help her to uplift her family to an appropriate lifestyle and also help her to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Phaon

texts.en:
A citizen of the Ponhea Leur district located in the Kandal province, Phaon is a 27-year-old woman. She is married with two children. Both of her children are living dependent on her. She raises her two children by farming and working in a factory. The average daily income for her family is only 22,000 KHR which is barely enough to support two children.

This is the second cycle for Phaon applying for a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. With the loan money, she will buy fertilizers and seeds to improve her farming business. Phaon optimistically believes that the microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund will allow her to uplift her family situation. As a mother of two little children, she wishes to provide enough food and appropriate clothes for her children like every other child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is a 34-year-old married woman currently residing in the Phnom Srouch district of Kompong Speu province. She has four children dependent on her. She is a farmer, so the yield of crops is the primary income source for her family. It earns her family just above 10,000 KHR per day.  

This is the first time that Rin is seeking a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy fertilizer in order to improve her farming yield. Rin hopes that the loan money enables her to uplift the lifestyle of the family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is a resident in the Ponhea Leur district of the Kandal province. She is a 32-year-old married woman with one daughter. As she struggles for her daughter's future, Phea managed to put her child in school even though she earns a very low income. She does farming and works as a paid construction worker to earn money as the primary sources of income for the whole family. She earns about 23,000 KHR per day which is barely enough to survive.  

Phea has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already. In this third cycle, she is seeking another microloan of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use the loan money to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve her farming business. Also, she will use a portion of the loan for transportation costs as she has to travel from her village to work as a paid construction worker. Phea strongly believes that the microloan will enable her to uplift her family lifestyle and will enable her to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es casada y tiene tres hijos y vive con ellos en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Maria es jubilada y percibe una renta, ella necesita un credito para pagar los impuestos de su vivienda, aunque el marido también aporta para el hogar, lo que ganan con sus rentas de jubilados no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y pagar los impuestos de la casa, por eso maria necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Maria is married and has three children who live with her in her cement and brick house in La Paz.  She is retired and receives a pension.  She needs this loan to pay the taxes on her home.  Even though her husband also contributes to the household expenses, their pensions are not enough to cover the household expenses and pay the taxes, so Maria needs help.

loans.use: to pay taxes on her home.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papa, tomates y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Paulina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who supports her family through her work.  She sells vegetables like carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and other things.  She is a responsible person and was invited to participate in the “Camino al Progreso” communal bank.  She needs this loan to buy vegetables.  She is grateful and values this loan and is committed to making her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya est majoritairement composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et  2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits de beautés (mèches, pommades et parfums) de meilleures qualités, habits et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Coumba  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beautés (mèches, pommades et parfums) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paquets de mèches, 2 cartons de pommades et 1 carton de parfums en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Bamako-Coura à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Coumba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group is mostly made up of monogamous women. They have an average age of 39 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships. The group members are small retailers of high-quality beauty products (hair extensions, creams and perfumes), clothing and cosmetics. The group members have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their first group loan.

Coumba (sitting on the left in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of high-quality beauty products (hair extensions, creams and perfumes). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 packets of hair extensions, 2 boxes of creams and 1 box of perfumes at the Grand Market. She makes her sales in Bamako-Coura to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Coumba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business. Her aim is to buy a plot of residential land thanks to her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy 10 packets of hair extensions, 2 boxes of creams and 1 box of perfumes.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
La dame Fatou est âgée de la cinquantaine, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon à 21 ans et le plus jeune, 2 ans, une fille. Fatou habite à des kilomètres du guichet, et elle vient pour la première fois solliciter ce crédit pour  acheter de la marchandise : des tissus et de la pâte d’arachide pour revendre. La pâte d’arachide est livrée au boutiquier et les tissus sont donné à crédit jusqu’à la fin du mois Fatou a acquis une expérience de plus de 05 ans dans ce domaine ; et elle est active toute la journée. Avec ses bénéfices, elle appuie ses enfants dans leur besoins au quotidien.
Fatou veut ouvrir un jour sa propre boutique pour pouvoir stocker sa marchandise.
texts.en: Fatou is in her 50s, married and the mother of 7 children. The eldest, a boy, is 21 years old and the youngest, a girl, is 2. Fatou lives a few kilometers away from the UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for the first time in order to buy some merchandise; fabrics and groundnut paste for resale. She delivers the groundnut paste to shopkeepers and sells the fabric on credit until the end of the month. Fatou has over 5 years experience in this line of work and works all day. She uses her profits to support her children with their daily needs. One day, Fatou would like to open a shop so that she can stock her own merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and groundnut paste for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Bamako-Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits wax, la boisson et la restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Coumba (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax ; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  60 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Coumba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The 4 women of the Benkadi group are married and mostly live in monogamous households. They have an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities at the Bamako-Coura market. The group members are small retailers of wax fabric clothing, drinks and prepared food. The group members have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their second group loan.

Coumba (standing second from the right in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She plans to use her loan to buy 60 pieces of wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash or credit at the market and on the street to a clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Coumba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to take care of the children in her household.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: This is Fe, a 41-year-old married woman with two children. She manages a farm business with the help of her husband. She is known in the community as having a kind heart and being a loving mother. Fe is asking for a loan from Kiva to have additional capital for her business. Fe dreams that she can give quality of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Aside from Nenita's housing rental services business, she also has a piggery that helps her to sustain their living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for boarding house repair. She is now able to provide better services to her customers to gain clients and be able to generate income from the services they've been provided. Recently, she took a new loan to buy feeds in order to boost her piggery. She hopes to build another unit to be used for business expansion as well as improving her current business for a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy feeds.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns and operates a farm, raising a variety of crops to earn a living. For eight years in helping her husband, she was able to sustain their daily needs and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. 
 
Josephine joined GDMPC and gains access to financial services and it helps to improve her business and living situation. Now, she borrowed a new loan  to purchase additional fertilizer, such as manure, to improve the whole farm. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements on her house and to ensure that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Palabra de mujer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre. El marido trabaja en un banco. 
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante, ella tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual vende todos tipo de artículos relacionados con la telefonía celular, vende equipos con planes contratados, repuestos y accesorios para todos tipo de teléfonos así como también recargas telefónicas de la empresa Movistar, lleva un año con este negocio y en este local el cual arrienda y el que pudo implementarlo gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la institución. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar teléfonos, accesorios y recargas telefónicas. Lleva  3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer credit groups meets every two weeks in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches which are much frequented all year long by both foreign and national tourists. Most of the residents work in fishing and other work related to the sea. 

This is where María lives. She is 24 years old and is in a common law marriage. Her husband works at a bank. María is an enterprising woman who likes to get ahead based on her hard work. She has a locale in the center of town where she sells all types of items related to cellular phones. She sells phones with contracts, replacement parts and accessories for all types of phones, as well as pre-paid cell service for the Movistar company. She has had this business for a year in the locale she rents and she was able to set it up thanks to the loans she has received from the institution.  

She is going to use this loan to buy telephones and pre-paid cell services. She has been in the credit group for 3 years and she likes it because of the help and benefits she gets from the bank. Her dream is to own her own locale.

loans.use: to buy telephones, accessories, and pre-paid telephone service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Elizabeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, invertirá el capital que está solicitando en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas y semilla, con esta compra seguirá cultivando granos básicos y mejorando las circunstancias familiares.
El efecto del financiamiento anterior fue sumamente favorable para el Sr. Juan, su tienda esta mejor abastecida de productos que cada día demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan will invest this loan in fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and seeds.  This will allow him to continue raising basic grains and improve his family situation.

The previous loan was helpful for Juan.  His store is better stocked with the products his demand.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
A resident in the Ksach Kandal district of the Kandal province, Sareoun is a 55-year-old married woman. In order to earn money to support her family, Sareoun has been farming for ages. In addition to that, she also struggles to earn some money from a fishery. These jobs provide Sareoun’s family an average of 10,200 KHR daily which is barely enough to cover basic expenses of the family.  

Sareoun has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for two cycles already. In this third cycle, she is seeking a microloan of 1,200,000 KHR. She will use the loan money to buy fertilizers to improve her farming business. Sareoun will also use a portion of the loan to cover education expenses for her children. She strongly believes that the loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, will enable her to uplift her family lifestyle and will enable her to live in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, a mother of two children, helps her husband run their farm in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham, in Cambodia. Farming is the major source of her family’s income, followed by the construction work that Phal's husband does when he is not needed on the farm. Through their hardships, Phal and her husband aim to educate their children and improve their farm, as well as the general living situations of the entire family.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with its special rates, Phal has been encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions for her family and protecting the environment. She will use the loan to build a hygienic toilet and septic tank to improve her household's sanitation.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and septic tank for her family

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is married with four children and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as an on-call carpenter but most of his time is focused on their farm as their main source of income, while Beatriz operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for farm inputs. She is preparing for this planting season, so to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit. In the future, her plan is to save her returns in order to buy an additional piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Roselyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Roselyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Nheob

texts.en:
Nheob lives in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She is now 42 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children attend school. Her family living depends mainly on their paddy rice farm. They earn 36,000 KHR on average per day.

Nheob has completed five loans with VisionFund. The previous loans gave her very good impact to the whole family's living. She is now requesting the sixth loan from VisionFund. The money will be used on the expense on the paddy rice farm such as fertilizer and seed purchasing. She will use the income to expand her business and to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and seed for rice field

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma helps her husband operate their own fishing business, raising fish, crabs, and shrimp in their fishpond. She has been working in this business for years, and she earns well for the family. 

The couple were determined enough to gain profit and were able to repay her previous loans successfully. She is hopeful to improve her business, and with sustained effort and perseverance, be able to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future. 

Recently, Emma took a new loan to buy feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising fish, crabs, and shrimp.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to stock up on mineral water for her business. Her earnings from this loan were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

To help continue her business operations, Josefina is requesting another 37,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Josefina hopes to gain more customers and dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaaline is 31 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past three years, Rosaaline has run a dry goods business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items for her retail business, including body lotion, school supplies, and other dry goods. In the future, Rosaaline would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as body lotion, school supplies, and other dry goods, for her retail business

loans.name: Kongkea

texts.en:
Kongkea is a widow who is residing in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal Province. As a thirty-three-year-old widow, she has three children living with and dependent on her. She has been farming for sixteen years. Kongkea also supplements the income by working as a tailor. Both jobs earn her family about 33,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second time that she seeks a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has repaid the first loan successfully, and it allowed her to improve her family’s condition. 

Kongkea is applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR to use mainly on her farming business. She optimistically believes that the loan will enable her to uplift her family’s lifestyle and provide her kids with enough food and keep them in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa de 61 años de edad,  tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta segundo grado, con lo difícil que resultaba el estudiar en ese tiempo decidió proponérselo y lograrlo. Ella tiene 3  hijos más nunca se casó, el hijo que esta  con ella lo tiene estudiando, con todo los gastos en los que se incurre el estudiar en estos días, nadie más vive con ellos.

El negocio que tiene es de venta de pollos ya solo de cocinarlos, los compra pequeños de un día de nacido y los cuida y engorda para luego venderlos ya lavados solo de cocinar, la necesidad de tener un ingreso al hogar, la motivo a trabajar con estas especies menores, por lo que hoy en día ha adquirido una buena clientela, para todo tipo de actividades que se realizan, es a ella a quien le encargan los pollos. No tenía otra actividad a la que se dedique, la granja la tiene en la casa, vendiendo un aproximado de 100 pollos al mes, cuando no tiene encargos le paga a una hermana que solo los venda de casa en casa por la comunidad.
     

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 200 pollos los que comprara de diferentes tamaños, para seguir con la actividad productiva, el mejoramiento será el poder tener un capital de trabajo, en el cual tendrá como suplir los pedidos.

El poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 and studied up to Grade 2. At this time it was difficult to study so she decided to postpone her studies. She has three children but she never got married. The son that lives with her is studying and she pays for those costs. No one else lives with them.

Her business is selling chickens ready to be cooked. She buys them when they are small, one day after birth, takes care of them and fattens them. Later she sells them, cleaned and ready to be cooked. The need to have income for her household motivated her to work with these small animals and today she has a large clientele. For any type of event that takes place she is the one to order chickens from. She has no other commercial activity.

Her farm is at her house and she sells about 100 chickens per month. When she doesn't have orders she pays a sister to sell them door-to-door in the community. The loan will be invested in buying 200 chickens of different sizes, to continue with her activity. The improvement will be having working capital with which she can buy supplies for her orders. Then she can supply the needs of her family and she hopes to continue working as long as God grants her health and life.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens.

loans.name: Som Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a 47-year-old married woman. She is living in Somrong Torng district of Kompong Speu province. Oun does farming to generate the main and only income source for the whole family. She has one son that goes to school and is dependent on her. The income from farming covers all expenses of the family including her son’s educational expenses.

Oun has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for two cycles already. In this third cycle, Oun is seeking a micro loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer to support her farming business. She strongly believes that the loan enables her to live in an appropriate lifestyle like every other family. She also hopes that she will have enough support to keep her son going to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a married woman who is residing in Samrong Torng district of Kompong Speu province. She is a 29-year-old mother that has two children dependent on her. The primary income source for the family is from farming. Sreyneang’s family earns 30,000 KHR every month which is barely enough to buy her children enough food.

This is the very first time that she seeks a micro loan of 1,200,000 KHR from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the loan money, Sreyneang will buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. In addition, she will also use a portion of it to cover school expenses for her children. She hopes that the loan enables her to uplift her family's lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 24 años de edad y reside junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia. Yesenia trabaja como empleada una empresa cercana a su localidad y de esta forma mantiene la economía de su familia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda puesto que desea ampliarla. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, lamina y madera puesto que hará los arranques de ladrillo ya que actualmente la casa es de adobe.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 24 years old and lives with her life partner in her own house. Yesenia works as an employee at a local company and this is how she provides income for the family, along with her partner. 

She is asking FUSAI for this loan to build a passageway in her home as she wants extend it. She will use the funds requested to buy cement, sand, bricks, laminated sheets and wood, as she wants to start building in brick. The house is currently made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, laminated sheets and wood to build a passageway for her home.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia vive en el distrito de Vilcabamba en la provincia de La Convencion, Cusco. Ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene 37 años de edad  y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas mas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. Ella agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Delia lives in the Vilcabamba district of the La Convencion province, Cusco. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who gets on in life thanks to her hard work. She is 37 years old and makes a living selling basic daily necessities such as rice, sugar, pasta and other items.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar. She is grateful to all the lenders for the support provided and promises to pay her instalments very responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is a fifty-eight-year-old married woman who resides in the Ksach Kandal District of Kandal Province. She has three children, all of whom attend school and are dependent on her. On a daily basis, Sarin earns an average of 5,600 KHR from selling fish. With her meager income, Sarin must work very hard to put her children in school. 

This is the third time Sarin is borrowing money from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sarin is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to fix her husband’s motorbike. In addition, Sarin plans to use a portion of the loan to cover her children’s school expenses. Sarin is optimistic that the loan will enable her to improve her family's situation and help keep her children in school.

loans.use: to fix her husband’s motorbike and pay for her children's school expenses

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
A citizen of the Samrong Torng district located in Kompong Speu province, Savorn is a 57-year-old married woman. Different from other families who do farming as the main family business, Savorn’s family raises and sells chickens and pigs as the primary income source. 

She has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for two cycles already. This is the third cycle for Savorn. She is applying for a micro loan of 2,000,000 KHR to expand her current business. With the loan money, she will buy more chickens and pigs for her business. Also she will use a portion of it to cover medical expenses for herself and the whole family. She hopes that the loan money from VisionFund enables her to live an upgraded lifestyle and provide the family sufficient basic needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Anny Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Estrella Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Anny, tiene 45  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 15 años  que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Anny los fines de semana y feriados instala un pequeño restaurante en su casa, con sus hijos atienden su negocio el cual es muy concurrido en estos días, su especialidad son los platos con mariscos y el pescado.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ella  se financia para salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este  crédito es para comprar vigveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Estrella Del Mar communal bank meets every fortnight in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by lots of national and foreign tourists throughout the year. Here most of the inhabitants make a living from fishing and related jobs.  

This is where Anny lives. She is 45 years old and is married, with two children aged 17 and 15 who are studying at college. Her husband works as a fisherman. At the weekends and on holidays Anny sets up a small restaurant in her home. She works with her children in the business, which is very busy on those days. Her specialities are fish and seafood dishes. 

She is taking out another loan, as this is how she has the finance to make progress in life and give her children what they need. This loan is to buy ingredients for preparing the dishes. She has been in the Communal Bank since the beginning and she likes it because she is able to make progress via the loans. Her dream is to have a large restaurant and provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela lleva aproximadamente 8 años trabajando como vendedora de mercancía puerta a puerta.
Entre los productos que vende se puede encontrar ropa interior femenina y ropa de dormir.
Los ingresos los destina en el sostenimiento de su casa uniéndolos con los ingresos de su esposo.
Ella desea ampliar su campo de acción y ofrecer otros productos como cosméticos y algunos otros productos de belleza, por esta razón desea un aliento económico y así darle el impulso que tanto necesita su negocio.
Esto le permitirá consolidar su actividad y tal vez en un futuro cumplir su sueño de tener un almacén en el que pueda ofrecer una amplia gama de productos de distintos tipos.
Su principal desafío es el cansancio físico que le genera el caminar todo el tiempo llevando a cuestas sus productos.
texts.en:
Mariela has been working as a door-to-door saleslady for approximately 8 years. Among the products that she sells, one can find ladies undergarments and sleepwear. She uses her earnings to support her home, adding it to her husband’s income. 

She wants to expand her enterprise and offer additional merchandise such as cosmetics and other beauty products, which is why she wants a loan—so that she can give her business a much needed boost.  This will allow her to consolidate her business and perhaps, in the future, achieve her dream of having a shop in which she could offer a wide range of products.

Her biggest challenge is the physical exhaustion caused by walking all the time and carrying her products.

loans.use: to purchase a range of products such as cosmetics and beauty items.

loans.name: Sinen

texts.en:
Sinen is a resident of Ro Veang district located in Presh Vihea province, Cambodia. She is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman and the mother of a four-year-old daughter. Her family's primary income comes from farming and raising pigs to sell. When she is not working on the farm, Sinen also goes to work for other local residents in order to earn extra income. She currently earns about 21,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet the family's needs. 

Sinen has been a borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles already and she has repaid her past loans successfully. In this third cycle, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her cash-crop. She also plans to use a portion of the loan for her pig business. As a hard working mother, she strongly believes that the loan from VisionFund will enable her to improve her family situation and live under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Soksan is living in Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province. He is a twenty-four years old married man. He has one son age three-years-old. The primary income source for Soksan’s family is from farming. In addition to that, he also works as a paid worker in order to earn extra money to support his family. Soksak can only earn an average of 11,000 KHR per day to feed his whole family.

This is the second loan cycle that Soksak is seeking for a micro loan from Kiva’s partner,VisionFund. He has successfully repaid the loan on the first cycle and it enabled him to increase the yield on his farm. With the loan money of 1,500,000 KHR, he plans to use it to buy fertilizer to maintain his farming business. He optimistically hopes that the loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, will enable him to uplift his family's lifestyle at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is a resident in Roveang district of Preah Vihear province. She is a twenty-year-old, married woman. The primary income source for her family is from a farming business. In addition to that, Lim also works as a paid laborer, in order to earn extra money to support her family. The average daily income for the whole family is only 14,000 KHR per day.

This is the very first time that she is seeking a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Lim is applying for loan money of 1,200,000 KHR. She plans to use the money to support her farming business. Moreover, she plans to use a portion of the money to plant potatoes in order to earn extra income. Lim strongly believes that the loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, enables her to uplift her family lifestyle in a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farming business

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun resides in the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province. She is a thirty-one-year-old, married woman. She has three children living dependent upon her. As a mother of three children, she does farming and is a paid worker for local residents, in order to earn money to support her family. The average daily income for the whole family is only 10,000 KHR, barely enough to buy food to feed her children.

Khun has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle already. She has repaid the past loan successfully. In this second loan cycle, she is seeking a microloan of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use it to buy fertilizer, to support her farming business. Also, she plans to use a portion of the loan to plant potatoes for selling, in order to earn extra income for her family. Khun strongly believes that the loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, enables her to uplift her family's lifestyle and keep her two children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to plant pototoes

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is a resident of Ro Veang district, located in Presh Vihea province. She is a twenty-seven-year-old, married woman. She has two little sons living dependent on her. As a mother of two young sons, Heng earns money from farming and working for local residents. On average, the daily income for her family is only 12,000 KHR per day.

She has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle already. She has successfully repaid the past loan. She is seeking another microloan of 1,000,000 KHR, for this second loan cycle. With the loan money, Heng plans to buy fertilizer to support her farming business. She also plans to use a portion of the money to plant potatoes for selling, in order to generate extra income for her family. She optimistically hopes that the loan will enable her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace and allow her to provide enough food for her little two sons.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to plant potatoes

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 41 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Remalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell, in her food stall.

In the future, Remalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of them in school. Evelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for 16 years.

Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional sacks of feed and other supplies for her business. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pig-fattening business

loans.name: Banco Mujer Monte Sión Group

texts.es:
Doña  Alba es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Monte Sión un grupo nuevo formado con 8 integrantes de un Asentamiento muy rural llamado Camuro. Todas las señoras tienen mucha experiencia en trabajo en equipo y organización, ya que desde hace mucho tiempo trabajan juntas en diferentes proyectos de la comunidad.
