Youn has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Rith is 28 years old and married with a son who is dependent and is too young for school. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for 10 years. This current business earns their family about 50,000KHR per day.

Rith has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He successfully used the previous loan to better support his family and increase his family’s business. Now he is applying for another loan. He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and increase his current business to better his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Youm

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Samlot district in the Battambang province, Youm is 60 years old and widowed with a son and a daughter who are dependent on her. In order to support her family, she earns a living through farming rice which she has been doing for 10 years. This current business earns their family about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is the first microloan cycle for Youm. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Sim, 40 years old, is married and has two daughters who are both in school. In order to support the family, Sim and her husband have farmed rice for the past 24 years, earning their family about 30,000 KHR per day.

Sim has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. She is now applying for another loan. Sim wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes, with this loan, to grow her rice successfully and to increase her business to better her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Ro Veang district of Preah Vihea province, Mao, 44 years old, is married and has one son who is in school. In order to support the family, Mao and her husband have farmed rice for 21 years, earning their family about 20,000 KHR per day.

Mao has been with VisionFund for six cycles. She successfully used the previous loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Mao is now applying for another loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her business to better her family’s living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 62 years old and lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is single and has one child. Lydia used her current loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her farm has grown and become successful. Positively, she hopes to be able to sustain her farm and to ensure that in the future she will have a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He has been raising livestock for more than 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.15,000.

Joseph has requested his first loan of KES.20,000 from Visionfund Kenya.to expand his business by buying more goats and sheep to rear and later sell at a profit. He will use those profits to buy more animals. His dream is to keep as many animals as possible for sale to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nheurn

texts.en:
Nheurn is aged 64 years, and a widow with two sons. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district. In order to support her family, she and her husband earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for 10 years.

Nheurn has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. She wants to use her loan to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is from a rural village of the Ro Veang district, of Preah Vihea province. She is 60 years old, married, and has no children who are dependent on her. In order to support their family, she and her husband earn a living by farming rice, which they have been doing for 30 years. This current business earns them about 10,000 KHR per day.

Run has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. With this loan, she wants to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business, to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Hugolina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Hugolina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. Hugolina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Hugolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ro Veang district, Preah Vihea province, Khoun is 44 years old. She is married and has three sons who are dependent on her. They are all in school. In order to support the family, she and her husband earn a living by farming rice, which they have been doing for 20 years. This current business earns their family about 20,000 KHR per day.

Khoun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. With this loan, she wants to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business, to better off her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ro Veang district of Preah Vihea province, Savon is a 38-year-old married mother of two daughters who are both in school. In order to support the family, Savon and her husband have been earning a living farming rice for 18 years now. This enterprise earns their family about 15,000KHR per day.

Savon has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. She used her previous loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business, She is now applying for another loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Seom

texts.en:
Seom is from a rural village of the Ro Veang district, in Presh Vihea province. She is 46 years old, married, and has one son and two daughters who are dependent on her. They are all in school. In order to support the family, Seom and her husband earn a living by farming rice, which they have been doing for 21 years. This current business earns their family about 10,000 KHR per day.

Seom has been with VisionFund for three previous loan cycles. She successfully used the previous loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business.

Now she is applying for another loan. With this loan, she wants to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business, to better off her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Estrelita engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks, within her village. She is 25 years old and has two schooling children. Due to financial hardship, she aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to obtain a loan of PHP 13,000. She will use it to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish and other ingredients she needs, which she will cook and sell. Through this financial assistance, she is hoping that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish and other ingredients

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 31-years-old, married and supporting three people in his family. His children are two; Bestmas Kiplagat, five years, and Ann Jemutai, one year. He runs a livestock trading business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. He has been in business for the last fourteen years; he gets an average monthly income of KSh. 25,000. He plans to use the amount borrowed of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase more cows for resale. He will use the profits from the cattle-trading business to sustain himself and his dependants.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Rainy Mae

texts.en:
Rainy Mae earns an income from selling snacks in the local communities. After more than five years, she saved up enough money to start up a retail business while her husband was earning an income from his shop. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to resell, and recently she took out a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en: Sokhea is a resident of Samrong Torng District located in Kampong Speu province. She is a 56-year-old married woman. Sokhea has one child who is dependent on her. Her primary income is from farming. On average she earns 22,500 KHR per day which makes it impossible for her to put her child in school. This is the sixth loan cycle that Sokea is requesting from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. With the loan money that she receives she plans to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cash-crop. She strongly believes that the loan will enable her to improve her family's situation and provide her with enough support to put her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cash-crop.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Voern

texts.en:
Voern is aged 24 years, and married with three daughters. One of whom attends school while two others are too young for in school. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district. In order to support her family, she and her husband earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for 10 years.

This is the first microloan cycle for Voern. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 35 years old, married, and has two children. The children are in school. Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for six years.

Fe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

Fe would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chomroeun

texts.en:
Chomroeun is a resident of a rural village of Batheay, Kampong Cham. He is a 29-year-old, married man, and a loving father of three children. He has been planting and harvesting rice and other seasonal crops to sell. Aside from farming, he also helps his wife sell kitchen utensils – spoons, plates, bowls, pots, and other related things -- to earn additional income.

In order to gain access to financial services and help him develop his business, Chomroeun is taking out a new loan. He will use it to buy kitchen materials to sell in his store. With the income generated from this investment, he aims to pay for his children’s education and cover their daily costs, and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell in his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth helps her husband manage their rice farm to earn a living.  Her income from the farm is used to meet the needs of her four children. With her  income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. To prepare for the next planting, she is asking for a new loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.  In the future, Elizabeth wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en: Ronila is a hardworking, 19-year-old lady. She is studying in a university, and she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. She is requesting this loan to pay tuition fees. Her goal is to find a better career, and she wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 36-year-old resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron is one of the areas affected when Typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. Jennifer’s business is getting up and she is working on expanding it again. She has two children and both are in grade school. She and her husband, who is a community official, manage their household as they do their work.

Jennifer operates a poultry business. She earns by selling live chickens to dealers. She also sells roasted chicken. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 10,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more chicken and feeds.

Jennifer dreams of having more poultry and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and feeds needed in her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron was one of the affected areas when typhoon Haiyan hit the Philippines last November, 2013. She is 33 years old and she is married to Eugenio, who works as a driver. They have one child who is not yet attending school. Few months after the typhoon, Marjorie’s business is recovering and she continues to work so her business will expand and grow. 

Marjorie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 23,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marjorie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cherry Mae is 33-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cherry Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. Cherry Mae requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cherry Mae has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cherry Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 44 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Samlot district of Battambang province, Chenda is 27 years old and married with one son who is dependent on her and now in school. In order to support the family, she and her husband earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for five years.

Chenda has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Samlot district of Battambang province, Chey is 31 years old and single. In order to support the family, he earns a living through farming rice which he has been doing for five years.

This is the first microloan cycle for Chey. He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and increase his current business to better off his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 46-year-old, married woman. She has a strong sense of responsibility. To support her family, she started making yogurt and olives at her house, and selling them. She recently started making detergents, as well, and selling them. Now she is seeking a loan. She will use it to purchase more raw materials, so that she will raise her productivity and sales.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making yogurt, olives, or detergents

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nienta est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage, copinage de parenté et de leurs activités génératrice de revenu au marché de Kalaban-Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades, mèches, …), pains,  habits et restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sadio  (femme assise en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 paquets de mèche et 4 cartons de pommades en gros au grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-Coura à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Sadio  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Nienta group is made up of five married women who are largely in monogamous households. On average, they are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and know one another through neighborhood ties, through friendships between their parents, and through their revenue-making businesses at the Kalaban-Coura market. The group members run small businesses selling cosmetic products (ointments, hair extensions...), breads, clothing, and prepared foods. With the goal of resupplying for cash, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle. Ms. Sadio (the woman seated third from the right to the left in the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of the finest-quality cosmetics products. She expects to use her loan to buy 30 packs of hair extensions and 4 boxes of ointments at wholesale at the large market. The resale of the products takes place at retail in Kalaban-Coura to a clientele mostly composed of women. Ms. Sadio hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a housing lot.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and ointments.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Chresensia is aged in her early fifties and has got five children; one is in school and four are grown. She is a divorcée and manages her family's cost by running a shop selling tailoring equipments; needles,clothes material, oils, etc. She is at her business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This is her fifteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to increase her shop stocks. Chresensia received an extra income from business which she used to buy home cooking pots, paid school fees and household expenses. She dreams of opening another shop and she will use this loan to replenish her business with new inventory.

Chresensia will share this loan with her loan group "LINDI", which totals two members. As joint members, together they will be accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with new inventory.

loans.name: Rosario Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Rosario Marleni se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosario Marleni sells beauty products. She sells lipstick, creams and perfumes. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has been doing this for a number of years. Her dream is to have a commercial space where she can sell her beauty products. She is requesting a loan to purchase creams, lipstick and perfumes. Rosario is happy about the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas y tambien para comprar medicinas para su salud.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Margarita, is devoted to her business selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and t-shirts. She has had this business several years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a convenience store.

This member is requesting the loan to purchase shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, blouses and also to pay for medicine for her health.

This member is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, t-shirts, sweaters and blouses and also to buy medicine for her health.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a widowed mother of three children. She was just 25 years old when her husband died. With the hardship of life she encountered when she was just a little girl, Rosalinda doesn’t want her children to experience that. She decided to work abroad just to feed her children and give them the necessities. Rosalinda worked abroad for 22 years and she was able to support her children’s education and they successfully finished their studies. Now, Rosalinda is managing a retail business in their village. She is selling charcoal and snack foods and at the same time receiving a daily payment for the rent of her tricycle. Rosalinda wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of her tricycle. She also plans to use the loan for her charcoal business. She hopes to earn enough income for her future and also help her grandchildren.

loans.use: for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged sons in the small village of Gardabani district. Her husband works at local farm and gets a small monthly income which is not enough to cover everyday expenses. Maia decided to open a market and be involved in her own business. She requested a loan. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase stock and will open a market. The income of the family will be increased and, with increased income, she will improve the living conditions of her family. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a market.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal Province, Noeun is 34 years old and single. In order to support the family, she earns a living through farming rice which she has been doing for 15 years. This current business earns their family about 25,000 KHR per day.

Noeun has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and improve her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lerfis Luz

texts.es:
Lerfis, de 39 años, es madre de 5 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante con todo el coraje y valentía que tiene.
Es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y dedicada con muchas ganas de progresar y tener gran estabilidad económica.
Se gana la vida criando cerdos de engorde y levante y posteriormente vendiéndolos a buen precio. Esta actividad la aprendió desde que era una niña ya que toda su vida ha vivido rodeada de actividades del campo.
Quiere que su negocio prospere, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para comprar algunas crías de cerdo y comprar materiales para realizar adecuaciones a sus marraneras. Entre estos materiales se pueden destacar mallas y madera.
Su mayor anhelo es que su negocio siga creciendo cada día mas generando los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Lerfis, age 39, is the mother of 5 children, whom she has raised with all of the strength and bravery that she possesses. She is a woman with a fighting spirit who is hardworking and dedicated, with a great desire to make progress and have financial stability. 

She earns a living by breeding and rearing fattening pigs, selling them later at a good price. She learned this occupation when she was a little girl, as she has lived all of her life surrounded by farming activities.

She wants her business to prosper, so she is requesting a loan in order to purchase some breeding pigs and materials to make modifications to her pig pens, especially wire mesh and wood. 

Her greatest desire is that her business will continue growing more every day, generating the income that is necessary for her family.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs and make modifications to her pig pens.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: José  es un joven nacido en Colombia, que por motivos de que no había trabajo en ese país se traslado a Ecuador y ya tiene nacionalidad ecuatoriana, comenta que en este país solamente tiene a una hermana que es casada, por este motivo vive solo en una casa donde paga arriendo, Jose se dedica a la ganadería y también trabaja pintando carros de un lugar a otro, Jose va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca,  él es un joven muy trabajador y comenta que tiene ahorrado un pequeño capital y que con las dos actividades a las que se dedica aspira completar una cantidad que le permita arrendar un local para poder poner su negocio propio de pintar carros.
texts.en:
José is a young man who was born in Colombia. For reasons of not having employment in this country he moved to Ecuador. He now has Ecuadorian citizenship. He says that in this country he only has a brother who is married so he lives alone in a house that he leases.

He raises livestock and he also works painting cars from place to place. Jose will invest in buying a cow. He is a hard-working young man and he comments that he has a small amount of capital saved and with his two activities he hopes to amass enough to rent a commercial space to open his own business painting cars.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom lives in Ksach Kanda District of Kandal Province. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. All of her children attend school. This big family depends mainly on their rice field. Sarom and her husband have been farming their rice field for 25 years.

Sarom has completed five loans with VisionFund already. The previous loans helped her family in improving their living. She is now requesting her sixth loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for their rice field. She expects that the income will help her to expand her current business as well as to pay for the family's food and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed for their rice field.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than lives in Ksach Kanda district of Kandal province. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children attend school. This big family depends mainly on their rice field for a living. Than and her husband have been farming their rice field for 10 years. They earn 34,000 riels (KHR) on average per day.

Than has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helped her family improve their standard of living. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti, 47, is living with her husband Abdullah, 62. They are blessed with seven children. Siti has been running a kiosk business for two years. The income earned from this business enables her to help her husband in covering their living expenses.

Currently, Siti wants to improve her business by filling the stock at her kiosk. By selling more items at her kiosk, she can generate more income; therefore, Siti would like to request a loan of 4,500,000 IDR from TLM. She will spend the loan on sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old. She is single and has been blessed with one child. She also has one adult dependent. She has applied for a loan of 23,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and plans to use the entire amount to buy desks for her students.

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 15,250 KES. She has been running her school for three years now. Through her anticipated income, she will expand her school and buy school supplies in bulk.

loans.use: to buy desks for her students.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for seven years. Gloria wants to be prepared for the next planting season and she has borrowed a new loan to purchase more volume of fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family. Her previous loan used for farm inputs was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia Sandra se dedica la negocio de venta de celulares y también vende recargar de saldo para celulares, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de celulares y recargas. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sandra makes a living selling mobile phones and she also sells credit for prepaid mobile phones. She works from 8:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m. She has already been working in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling cellular phones and phone credit. She is requesting the loan to buy mobile phones. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones

loans.name: Siza

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Siza works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Siza is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a married hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a bar, hotel and a video showroom to generate income. He hopes to grow his businesses but is challenged by poor roads and high license fees on his businesses. Emmanuel is asking for a loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Srey Nak

texts.en:
Srey Nak lives in Ksach Kanda District of Kandal Province. She is 29 years old, married and has three children. Her eldest daughter attends school. This big family depends mainly on their rice field. Srey Nak and her husband have been farming their rice field for ten years.

Srey Nak has completed three loans with VisionFund already. The previous loans helped her family with improving their living. She is now requesting her fourth loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for their rice field. She expects that the income will help her to expand her current business as well as to pay for the family's food and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and seed.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 44 years old and has six children. Marietta is married and has six children who are in school. Marietta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marietta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business. Marietta has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Charmagne

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Charmagne works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Charmagne is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Charmagne has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pheon

texts.en:
Pheon lives in the Ksach Kanda district of Kandal province. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Her eldest attends school; the youngest is only three years old. This family's living depends mainly on their rice field. She and her husband have been doing the rice field for 10 years. They earn 37,000 KHR on average per day

She has completed two loans with VisionFund already. The previous loans help her family improve their living. She is now requesting her second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and to pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: To have additional source of income, Minerva engages in raising hogs within their community. She is 47 years old and has two children attending school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, the family needed to earn a higher income in order to support their children's education. In this regard, Minerva aims to improve her hog-raising business to earn a higher income. Having limited capital, Minerva is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in raising hogs. She believes that someday, she will improve the business and increase her income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Yenni

texts.en:
Yenni is 34 years old and married to Oktovianus, a 42 year old man. They have been blessed with three children: Nindy, 12, 1st grade of Junior High School; Nita, 9, 3rd grade of Elementary School; and Desta, 5. 

Yenni has been running a small kiosk business at home for a year. She sells daily basic needs such as: cooking oil, coffee, salt, cereal and snacks, and candies for children.  Even though the income earned from the business is a small amount, it enables her to help her husband in covering the cost of her family's daily needs.

Currently Yenni dreams of improving her business by adding more stock at her kiosk but she does not have the capital to follow this plan. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. This loan will be spent on more kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla was born in 1985. She is a married lady who has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions before having any children. 

Khawla has been selling blankets at her house for 3 years. After having expanded her customer base, she is seeking a youth loan now in order to buy more blankets so that she will raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.
